thread.title: International DJs spin at Ponderosa Stomp Hip Drop VII: Stomp DJ Kick-Off
thread.title_full: International DJs spin at Ponderosa Stomp Hip Drop VII: Stomp DJ Kick-Off | NOLA.com

author: Sue Strachan, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: International DJs spin at Ponderosa Stomp Hip Drop VII: Stomp DJ Kick-Off
text:
Billed as "The official pre-Ponderosa Stomp DJ All-Nighter of R&B, Soul, Garage and Deep Funk 45 Madness" the Hip Drop VII: Stomp DJ Kick-Off at d.b.a. on Thursday (Oct. 1) was a musical jumpstart and homecoming for musicians and fans for the 12 th annual Ponderosa Stomp.
Started in 2007 by DJ Soul Sister with help from Brice Nice , the kick-off event was created to gather all of their DJ compatriots who attending the Ponderosa Stomp and have them spin their 45s for the night.
Soul Sister was part of this year's Hip Drop, as was Prince Pauper and Swamp Boogie (both New Orleans), Shimmy Shammy (C.C. Brown, Dusty Stylus, Lady Blades, Mohair Slim, from Melbourne, Australia); Jezebelle (Birmingham), Carlos Ren√© and Elisse Locomotion (Mexico City), El Westside Sound (San Antonio), Russell Quan (San Francisco), The Stepfather of Soul (Jason Stone) and Electro-Phonic Brian (Brian Phillips, both from Atlanta), and Gary "Gazfunk" Small (Belfast).
The Ponderosa Stomp -- a bi-annual "celebration of the unsung heroes of American music" -- was founded by Dr. Ira Padnos (a.k.a. "Dr. Ike"). It continues Friday (Oct. 2), with Freddy "Boom Boom" Cannon with Los Straightjackets, Betty Harris, and R.L. Boyce on the extensive lineup, while Irma Thomas, Barbara Lynn and Jimmy "Pistol" Jules are just a few onstage at Rock 'n' Bowl on Saturday.
Read more about the Stomp here: Ponderosa Stomp to present two epic nights of 'unsung heroes' at Rock 'n' Bowl
*
